basics.name: Gülce Apaydın
basics.label: Computer Science & Mathematics Student
basics.summary: Perpetual student. Driven by curiosity and a passion for math & computer science. There’s so much more to learn, and I’m excited for the journey ahead. Ad astra!

work.name: Autodesk
work.summary: Worked on Autodesk's MotionBuilder and Maya products.
achievements: In MotionBuilder,enhanced application stability by fixing critical defects for HiDPI support.
Facilitated collaboration with external partners by resolving a CUDA build issue on Windows and Linux platforms.
Increased development efficiency by creating a script to locate all icons within the application, then integrated the first batch of SVG icons, modernizing the UI from outdated PNG formats.
In Maya, contributed to application reliability by fixing defects and adding small features.
Improved code quality and future-proofing by implementing unit tests, enhancing the overall stability of the code base.

work.name: Hack4Impact
achievements: Improved website usability by fixing several defects, enabling smooth donation tracking for UAEM through the MERN stack.
Currently working on another project for the Welcome Collective, developing an inventory website for volunteers to be able to check in and out items.

work.name: Computer Science Undergraduate Society
work.summary: Providing help to students with their computer science courses.
achievements: Enhanced student success by providing targeted debugging assistance and assignment guidance at the Helpdesk, which supports approximately 300 students per semester, resulting in improved understanding and performance in challenging courses.

Tutoring for the following courses: COMP 202 (Foundations of Programming), COMP 206 (Intro to Software Systems), COMP 250 (Intro to Computer Science), COMP 251 (Algorithms and Data Structures), COMP 273 (Intro to Computer Systems).

work.name: McGill Robotics
work.summary: Developing software for the Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV) team.
achievements: Increased vision accuracy by resolving 100% of defects in the Autonomous Underwater Vehicle’s ROS-based navigation system, significantly enhancing object detection for the RoboSub competition.

work.name: Girls Who Code
work.summary: Volunteered to teach coding at local schools.
achievements: Improved coding literacy among 17 high school and elementary students through over 25 weekly lessons in Python and Scratch, by designing and delivering engaging lesson plans that led to significant improvements in their programming skills.
